data.title: Perier, Casimir Pierre to Louis, Joseph-Dominique, Paris, LS, 05/23/1831
data.text:
From the Series:

The documents consist largely of letters to and from Napoleon and his military & political associates, letters between Napoleon and members of his family and among family members, and a few autograph documents of artistic and literary notables of the Napoleonic era. Important materials concern Napoleon’s exile and death at St. Helena; the marriage of Pauline Bonaparte and Camillo Borghese; and correspondence between Napoleon’s legitimate son, Francois, and his mother Marie-Louise of Austria.

Abbreviations for type of material are as follows: AL = Autograph letter; ALS = Autograph letter, signed; LS = Letter, signed; ADS = Autograph document, signed; DS = Document, signed.

Box 27 consists of the book, Cavaliers de Napoléon by Frédéric Masson ; illustrations d’apre`s les tableaux et aquarelles de E´douard Detaille (Paris : Boussod, Valadon & Cie, 1895). The book was formerly cataloged as Case MS 6A 383.

The Spencer Napoleonica collection is open for research in the Special Collections Reading Room; 5 folders at a time maximum, and items in each folder will be counted before and after delivery to the patron (Priority I).
